ThingDef.Name: VOV_Basilisk_Torrent_BPistol_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Basilisk-Torrent bolt pistol
ThingDef.description: This version of the Basilisk bolt pistol is often used by Vagar boarding parties in close-quarters combat, where firepower is more important than accuracy. More compact than a full-sized bolter and utilizing a drum magazine, this pistol can unleash a torrent of explosive bolts against nearby foes. The massive recoil makes it ineffective at longer ranges, however.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.Name: VOV_Boggart_BCarbine_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Boggart bolt carbine
ThingDef.description: The Basilisk bolt pistol is often (and rightfully) criticized for being large and unwieldy. However, by adding a folding stock and a rudimentary front grip it can be turned into a surprisingly convenient bolt carbine.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.label: persona Boggart-Sprinter bolt carbine
ThingDef.description: Sporting a collimator sight and a vertical front grip, this Boggart bolt carbine was optimized for close-quarters combat.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.Name: VOV_Boggart_Pioneer_BCarbine_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Boggart-Pioneer bolt carbine
ThingDef.description: Due to its relatively low mass and bulk, the Boggart bolt carbine became a popular weapon among the Vagar Pioneers, a collection of explorers and prospectors, who asteroids and unexplored worlds in search of resources to exploit and communities to trade with. This particular carbine was outfitted with a collimator sight and wooden furniture - a luxury among the Vagar, as genuine wood is rare in space.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.Name: VOV_Enceladus_Sprinter_BCaliver_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Enceladus-Sprinter bolt caliver
ThingDef.description: Foregoing the barrel extension typical for bolt calivers, this weapon has been tailored for close to medium range engagements. The Vagar Hearthguard milita are notably fond of such weapons for their lightness and simplicity.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.Name: VOV_Enceladus_Stalker_BCaliver_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Enceladus-Stalker bolt caliver
ThingDef.description: This Enceladus bolt caliver has been fitted with a powerful telescopic sight, turning it into a remarkably dangerous marksman rifle.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.Name: VOV_Enceladus_Cerberus_BCaliver_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Enceladus-Cerberus bolt caliver
ThingDef.description: Expensive wooden furniture, intricate brass decorations and leather-bound foregrip - even for a Vagar weapon this caliver is remarkably ornate. Such firearms are typically found in posession of Vagar nobility or their honor guard. The cleaver-style bayonet decorated with an inspirational inscription on the blade only adds to the weapon's lavishness (and deadliness).\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.Name: VOV_Gorgon_Torrent_Bolter_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Gorgon-Torrent bolter
ThingDef.description: While similar to the original Gorgon bolter, albeit with a large drum magazine, this support bolter nevertheless features a number of improvements. The internal mechanics were refined and some of the polymer parts were substituted with perforated sheet metal for extra robustness. As with the other Torrent-style firearms, this bolter is meant to be a squad support weapon.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.Name: VOV_Godwyn_Bolter_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Godwyn bolter
ThingDef.description: The original Gorgon bolter was designed to be useable both by warriors in powered armor and by those without it, which led to the weapon being rather disappointing in its performance. Realizing their mistake, the Vagar warsmiths created the Godwyn pattern of boltgun. With a larger magazine and heavier recoil compensator, this weapon has become even deadlier at the cost of significant weight increase.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.Name: VOV_Godwyn_Snapper_Bolter_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Godwyn-Snapper bolter
ThingDef.description: This weapon is a result of an attempt to reduce the weight of the Godwyn bolter without sacrificing its combat effectiveness. The attempt was moderately successful, as Godwyn-Snapper is almost as light as the Gorgon bolter.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.Name: VOV_Godwyn_Sprinter_Bolter_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Godwyn-Sprinter bolter
ThingDef.description: Outfitted with a collimator sight and a vertical front grip, this Godwyn bolter has been configured for close-quarters combat.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.Name: VOV_Godwyn_Stalker_Bolter_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Godwyn-Stalker bolter
ThingDef.description: This Godwyn bolter was fitted with a telescopic sight, a barrel extension and a preyseeker to bridge the gap between ordinary bolters and bolt calivers, creating a weapon that is reasonably effective at both medium and long ranges. The weight of the attachments meant that the magazine capacity had to be sacrificed, however.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.

ThingDef.Name: VOV_Gereon_Bolter_Bond
ThingDef.label: persona Gereon bolter
ThingDef.description: A pinnacle of mass-produced bolter designs, the Gereon bolter was loosely based on the Godwyn pattern. While the latter utilises a receiver assembly protected by a top cover, the Gereon splits the receiver into the upper half, containing most of the internal mechanisms, and the lower half, containing the trigger group and the magazine well. The differences do not stop there, however. The weapon is fitted with a sophisticated motion-predictor scope linked to a preyseeker under the front grip, which greatly reduce the target acquisition speed. Finally, the bolter is decorated with wooden furniture and anodized titanium trim and decorative plates. Naturally, all of this comes at a price, and thus it is rare to see such magnificent weapons in the hands of rank-and-file troops.\n\nThis weapon has an onboard persona that can bond to only a single person. The wielder and intelligent weapon can synchronize their reflexes and attack with frightening speed, accuracy, and creativity. Once bonded to a wielder, the weapon's persona will refuse to be wielded by anyone else.
